headline: 2 Large-Cap Stocks to Own for Decades and 1 We Brush Off
summary: Large-cap stocks are known for their staying power and ability to weather market storms better than smaller competitors. However, their sheer size makes it more challenging to maintain high growth rates as they’ve already captured significant portions of their markets.

raw.headline: 2 Large-Cap Stocks to Own for Decades and 1 We Brush Off
raw.summary: Large-cap stocks are known for their staying power and ability to weather market storms better than smaller competitors. However, their sheer size makes it more challenging to maintain high growth rates as they’ve already captured significant portions of their markets.

headline: EnerSys, GE Aerospace, REV Group, Avis Budget Group, and Universal Logistics Shares Plummet, What You Need To Know

headline: White House Touts $270 Billion Worth of Deals at Saudi-palooza
summary: A day after the White House proclaimed that Saudi Arabia boosted its spring pledge to invest $600 billion in the US to a tidy $1 trillion during Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman’s visit to Washington, DC, President Donald Trump said companies from both nations inked $270 billion in deals at a US-Saudi business forum.  No timeline was given for Saudi Arabia’s $1 trillion in investments and, while the US-Saudi Investment Forum on Wednesday drew corporate royalty from Chevron, Tesla, Nvidia, Qualcomm, Cisco, General Dynamics, Pfizer and more, it wasn’t immediately clear which companies inked deals.  Trump did say GE Aerospace will “deliver dozens of new engines” while a handful of other pacts, while short on financial details, highlighted some international bargaining.

headline: Middle East Engine Deals Might Change The Case For Investing In General Electric (GE)
summary: Saudia Group has announced a major agreement with GE Aerospace to supply GEnx-1B engines, maintenance, and technical training for its fleet of Boeing 787s, alongside significant new engine deals recently made with flydubai and Emirates for their expanding long-haul operations. These contracts illustrate strong demand for GE's advanced propulsion technology and deepen its international partnerships, particularly in the Middle East, supporting the localization of aerospace expertise. We'll...
